simulation_metadata.why_this_matters_for_getting_hired: Modern HR Managers must use AI responsibly and strategically. Misuse increases bias, cost, and legal risk.

steps.context: You are an HR professional exploring AI tools for the first time. Your manager says: 'Can we use ChatGPT to speed up JD writing?'

learning_material.title: What is AI Prompting?
content: AI amplifies bias present in the prompt.

example.strong: Write a Senior Data Scientist JD (5+ years) with structured sections and inclusive language.

steps.artefact_interaction_description: Review two AI prompt examples in comparison view.
options_inputs: Prompt A: Write a job description.
Prompt B: Write a job description for a Senior Data Scientist (5+ years) including Responsibilities, Must-Have Skills, Nice-to-Have Skills, and Impact. Use inclusive language.
steps.question: Which prompt will produce more reliable output?

consequence.correct: Structured prompts reduce editing time by 60%.
consequence.incorrect: Vague prompts lead to unpredictable and inflated outputs.

steps.context: You must choose which AI model to use for HR drafting tasks.

learning_material.title: AI Tool Basics for HR
content: Different models vary in cost and capability.
Higher models = better reasoning but higher cost.
Credit limits matter for high-volume HR teams.

steps.question: For sensitive HR drafting (bias control, structured output), which model tier is safer?
options_inputs: Lowest cost model regardless of quality
Balanced model with strong reasoning and moderate cost

consequence.correct: You reduce legal risk while managing cost.
consequence.incorrect: Poor model choice may amplify bias or produce unreliable drafts.

steps.context: Hiring Manager says: 'We need a rockstar Senior Data Scientist. Make it aggressive and exciting.' Deadline: EOD.

learning_material.title: Translating Stakeholder Language
content: Convert personality descriptors into competency descriptors.

example.strong_translation: Results-driven professional with advanced ML expertise.

steps.artefact_interaction_description: Review the draft prompt in a one-page memo view.
steps.question: Select the two instructions that improve output quality.

consequence.correct: Your JD will attract broader qualified candidates.
consequence.incorrect: AI will amplify biased tone or inflate requirements.

steps.context: You finalize the prompt and generate AI output.

learning_material.title: Diagnose Before Editing
content: Fix prompt constraints, not output text.

steps.artefact_interaction_description: Review AI output in comparison mode (Structured vs Inflated).
steps.question: Identify the root cause of 12 must-have skills appearing.

consequence.correct: Adding must-have limits fixes output permanently.
consequence.incorrect: Manual editing will not prevent recurrence.

simulation_metadata.simulation_title: AI Resume Screening with Fairness Controls

steps.context: 200 resumes received. Hiring Manager wants shortlist by tomorrow.

example.strong: Rate 1-10 on product strategy (5+ years), leadership, data-driven decisions. Provide 2-sentence justification.

steps.artefact_interaction_description: Select screening prompt using candidate tiles.
steps.question: Choose the most structured screening instruction.
options_inputs: Evaluate and rate 1-10 on defined criteria with justification.

steps.context: AI flags candidates with career gaps lower.

learning_material.title: Handling Employment Gaps Fairly
content: Do not penalize employment gaps automatically.

steps.question: What constraint should you add?
options_inputs: Do not penalize employment gaps. Evaluate skills and trajectory.

consequence.correct: Candidate diversity improves without reducing quality.
consequence.incorrect: Qualified candidates may be filtered unfairly.
